OSD6_SAVE_X.Description: Horizontal position of Save button on screen

OSD6_SAVE_Y.Description: Vertical position of Save button on screen

OSD_ARM_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on Arm event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_BTN_DELAY.Description: Debounce time in ms for stick commanded parameter navigation.

OSD_CELL_COUNT.Description: Used for average cell voltage display. -1 disables, 0 uses cell count autodetection for well charged LIPO/LIION batteries at connection, other values manually select cell count used.

OSD_CHAN.Description: This sets the channel used to switch different OSD screens.

OSD_DSARM_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on disarm event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_FONT.Description: This sets which OSD font to use. It is an integer from 0 to the number of fonts available

OSD_FS_SCR.Description: Screen to be shown on failsafe event. Zero to disable the feature.

OSD_H_OFFSET.Description: Sets horizontal offset of the osd inside image

Bitmask.3: Convert feet to miles at 5280ft instead of 10000ft

OSD_OPTIONS.Description: This sets options that change the display

OSD_SW_METHOD.Description: This sets the method used to switch different OSD screens.

Values.0: switch to next screen if channel value was changed
Values.1: select screen based on pwm ranges specified for each screen
Values.2: switch to next screen after low to high transition and every 1s while channel value is high

OSD_TYPE.Description: OSD type. TXONLY makes the OSD parameter selection available to other modules even if there is no native OSD support on the board, for instance CRSF.

OSD_TYPE2.Description: OSD type 2. TXONLY makes the OSD parameter selection available to other modules even if there is no native OSD support on the board, for instance CRSF.

OSD_UNITS.Description: Sets the units to use in displaying items

OSD_V_OFFSET.Description: Sets vertical offset of the osd inside image

OSD_W_ACRVOLT.Description: Set level at which ACRVOLT item will flash
OSD_W_ACRVOLT.DisplayName: Avg Cell Resting Volt warn level

OSD_W_AVGCELLV.Description: Set level at which AVGCELLV item will flash

OSD_W_BATVOLT.Description: Set level at which BAT_VOLT item will flash

OSD_W_LQ.Description: Set level at which RC_LQ item will flash (%)

OSD_W_NSAT.Description: Set level at which NSAT item will flash

OSD_W_RESTVOLT.Description: Set level at which RESTVOLT item will flash

OSD_W_RSSI.Description: Set level at which RSSI item will flash (in positive % or negative dBm values as applicable). 30% or -100dBm are defaults.

OSD_W_SNR.Description: Set level at which RC_SNR item will flash (in db)

OSD_W_TERR.Description: Set level below which TER_HGT item will flash. -1 disables.

OVERRIDE_CHAN.Description: If set to a non-zero value then this is an RC input channel number to use for giving IO manual control in case the main FMU microcontroller on a board with a IO co-processor fails. When this RC input channel goes above 1750 the FMU microcontroller will no longer be involved in controlling the servos and instead the IO microcontroller will directly control the servos. Note that IO manual control will be automatically activated if the FMU crashes for any reason. This parameter allows you to test for correct manual behaviour without actually crashing the FMU. This parameter is can be set to a non-zero value either for ground testing purposes or for giving the effect of an external override control board. Note that you may set OVERRIDE_CHAN to the same channel as FLTMODE_CH to get IO based override when in flight mode 6. Note that when override is triggered due to a FMU crash the 6 auxiliary output channels on the FMU will no longer be updated, so all the flight controls you need must be assigned to the first 8 channels on boards with an IOMCU.

PLND_ACC_P_NSE.Description: Kalman Filter Accelerometer Noise, higher values weight the input from the camera more, accels less

PLND_ALT_CUTOFF.Description: The altitude (rangefinder distance) below which we stop using the precision landing sensor and continue landing

PLND_ALT_MAX.Description: Vehicle will continue landing vertically until this height if target is not found. Below this height if landing target is not found, landing retry/failsafe might be attempted. This needs a rangefinder to work. Set to zero to disable this.

PLND_ALT_MIN.Description: Vehicle will continue landing vertically even if target is lost below this height. This needs a rangefinder to work. Set to zero to disable this.

PLND_BUS.Description: Precland sensor bus for I2C sensors.

PLND_CAM_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

PLND_CAM_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

PLND_CAM_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

PLND_EST_TYPE.Description: Specifies the estimation method to be used

PLND_LAG.Description: Precision Landing sensor lag, to cope with variable landing_target latency

PLND_LAND_OFS_X.Description: Desired landing position of the camera forward of the target in vehicle body frame

PLND_LAND_OFS_Y.Description: desired landing position of the camera right of the target in vehicle body frame

Bitmask.1: Allow Precision Landing after manual reposition
Bitmask.2: Maintain high speed in final descent

PLND_RET_BEHAVE.Description: Prec Land will do the action selected by this parameter if a retry to a landing is needed

Values.0: Go to the last location where landing target was detected
Values.1: Go towards the approximate location of the detected landing target

PLND_RET_MAX.Description: PrecLand Maximum number of retires for a failed landing. Set to zero to disable landing retry.
PLND_RET_MAX.DisplayName: PrecLand Maximum number of retires for a failed landing

PLND_STRICT.Description: How strictly should the vehicle land on the target if target is lost

PLND_TIMEOUT.Description: Time for which vehicle continues descend even if target is lost. After this time period, vehicle will attempt a landing retry depending on PLND_STRICT parameter.

PLND_XY_DIST_MAX.Description: The vehicle will not start descending if the landing target is detected and it is further than this many meters away. Set 0 to always descend.
PLND_XY_DIST_MAX.DisplayName: Precision Landing maximum distance to target before descending

PLND_YAW_ALIGN.Description: Yaw angle from body x-axis to sensor x-axis.

POI_DIST_MAX.Description: POI's max distance (in meters) from the vehicle

PREV_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to used to trigger parameter reversion

PTCH2SRV_RLL.Description: Gain added to pitch to keep aircraft from descending or ascending in turns. Increase in increments of 0.05 to reduce altitude loss. Decrease for altitude gain.

PTCH2SRV_RMAX_DN.Description: This sets the maximum nose down pitch rate that the attitude controller will demand (degrees/sec) in angle stabilized modes. Setting it to zero disables the limit.

PTCH2SRV_RMAX_UP.Description: This sets the maximum nose up pitch rate that the attitude controller will demand (degrees/sec) in angle stabilized modes. Setting it to zero disables the limit.

PTCH2SRV_TCONST.Description: Time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved pitch angle. Most models respond well to 0.5. May be reduced for faster responses, but setting lower than a model can achieve will not help.

PTCH_LIM_MAX_DEG.Description: Maximum pitch up angle commanded in modes with stabilized limits.

PTCH_LIM_MIN_DEG.Description: Maximum pitch down angle commanded in modes with stabilized limits

PTCH_RATE_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
PTCH_RATE_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain

PTCH_RATE_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

PTCH_RATE_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
PTCH_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

PTCH_RATE_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
PTCH_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

PTCH_RATE_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
PTCH_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

PTCH_RATE_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
PTCH_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

PTCH_RATE_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
PTCH_RATE_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

PTCH_RATE_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
PTCH_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum

PTCH_RATE_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
PTCH_RATE_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain

PTCH_RATE_PDMX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
PTCH_RATE_PDMX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller PD sum maximum

PTCH_RATE_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

PTCH_TRIM_DEG.Description: Offset in degrees used for in-flight pitch trimming for level flight. Correct ground leveling is an alternative to changing this parameter.

QUIK_AUTO_FILTER.Description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

QUIK_AUTO_SAVE.Description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME.Description: Time to double a tuning parameter. Raise this for a slower tune.

QUIK_GAIN_MARGIN.Description: Reduction in gain after oscillation detected. Raise this number to get a more conservative tune

QUIK_MAX_REDUCE.Description: This controls how much quicktune is allowed to lower gains from the original gains. If the vehicle already has a reasonable tune and is not oscillating then you can set this to zero to prevent gain reductions. The default of 20% is reasonable for most vehicles. Using a maximum gain reduction lowers the chance of an angle P oscillation happening if quicktune gets a false positive oscillation at a low gain, which can result in very low rate gains and a dangerous angle P oscillation.

QUIK_OPTIONS.Description: Additional options. When the Two Position Switch option is enabled then a high switch position will start the tune, low will disable the tune. you should also set a QUIK_AUTO_SAVE time so that you will be able to save the tune.

QUIK_OSC_SMAX.Description: Threshold for oscillation detection. A lower value will lead to a more conservative tune.

QUIK_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

QUIK_RP_PI_RATIO.Description: Ratio between P and I gains for roll and pitch. Raise this to get a lower I gain

QUIK_YAW_D_MAX.Description: Maximum value for yaw D gain

QUIK_YAW_P_MAX.Description: Maximum value for yaw P gain

QUIK_Y_PI_RATIO.Description: Ratio between P and I gains for yaw. Raise this to get a lower I gain

Q_ACRO_PIT_RATE.Description: The maximum pitch rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Q_ACRO_RLL_RATE.Description: The maximum roll rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Q_ACRO_YAW_RATE.Description: The maximum yaw rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Q_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all VTOL flight modes

Q_ASSIST_ALT.Description: This is the altitude below which quadplane assistance will be triggered. This acts the same way as Q_ASSIST_ANGLE and Q_ASSIST_SPEED, but triggers if the aircraft drops below the given altitude while the VTOL motors are not running. A value of zero disables this feature. The altitude is calculated as being above ground level. The height above ground is given from a Lidar used if available and RNGFND_LANDING=1. Otherwise it comes from terrain data if TERRAIN_FOLLOW=1 and comes from height above home otherwise.

Q_ASSIST_ANGLE.Description: This is the angular error in attitude beyond which the quadplane VTOL motors will provide stability assistance. This will only be used if Q_ASSIST_SPEED is also non-zero. Assistance will be given if the attitude is outside the normal attitude limits by at least 5 degrees and the angular error in roll or pitch is greater than this angle for at least Q_ASSIST_DELAY seconds. Set to zero to disable angle assistance.

Q_ASSIST_DELAY.Description: This is delay between the assistance thresholds being met and the assistance starting.

Q_ASSIST_SPEED.Description: This is the speed below which the quad motors will provide stability and lift assistance in fixed wing modes. Zero means no assistance except during transition. Note that if this is set to zero then other Q_ASSIST features are also disabled. A higher value will lead to more false positives which can waste battery. A lower value will result in less false positive, but will result in assistance taking longer to trigger. If unsure then set to 3 m/s below the minimum airspeed you will fly at. If you don't have an airspeed sensor then use 5 m/s below the minimum airspeed you fly at. If you want to disable the arming check Q_ASSIST_SPEED then set to -1.

Q_AUTOTUNE_AGGR.Description: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

Q_A_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

Q_A_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
Q_A_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

Q_A_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate
Q_A_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain

Q_A_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate
Q_A_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain

Q_A_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate
Q_A_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain

Q_A_INPUT_TC.Description: Attitude control input time constant.  Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

Q_A_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedforward is enabled or disabled

Q_A_RATE_P_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

Q_A_RATE_R_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

Q_A_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

Q_A_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
Q_A_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain

Q_A_RAT_PIT_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate
Q_A_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum

Q_A_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate output
Q_A_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain

Q_A_RAT_PIT_PDMX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
Q_A_RAT_PIT_PDMX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller PD sum maximum

Q_A_RAT_PIT_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Q_A_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
Q_A_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain

Q_A_RAT_RLL_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
Q_A_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain

Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum

Q_A_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
Q_A_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain

Q_A_RAT_RLL_PDMX.Description: Roll axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
Q_A_RAT_RLL_PDMX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller PD sum maximum

Q_A_RAT_RLL_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Q_A_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
Q_A_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain

Q_A_RAT_YAW_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
Q_A_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain

Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum

Q_A_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain.  Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate
Q_A_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain

Q_A_RAT_YAW_PDMX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
Q_A_RAT_YAW_PDMX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller PD sum maximum

Q_A_RAT_YAW_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Q_A_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in RTL and Auto flight modes

Q_A_THR_G_BOOST.Description: Throttle-gain boost ratio. A value of 0 means no boosting is applied, a value of 1 means full boosting is applied. Describes the ratio increase that is applied to angle P and PD on pitch and roll.

Q_A_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_A_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_A_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_BACKTRANS_MS.Description: Pitch angle will increase from 0 to angle max over this duration when switching into VTOL flight in a postion control mode. 0 Disables.
Q_BACKTRANS_MS.DisplayName: SLT and Tiltrotor back transition pitch limit duration

Q_BCK_PIT_LIM.Description: This sets the maximum number of degrees of back or pitch up in Q modes when the airspeed is at AIRSPEED_MIN, and is used to prevent excessive sutructural loads when pitching up decelerate. If airspeed is above or below AIRSPEED_MIN, the pitch up/back will be adjusted according to the formula pitch_limit = Q_BCK_PIT_LIM * (AIRSPEED_MIN / IAS)^2. The backwards/up pitch limit controlled by this parameter is in addition to limiting applied by PTCH_LIM_MAX_DEG and Q_ANGLE_MAX. The BCK_PIT_LIM limit is only applied when Q_FWD_THR_USE is set to 1 or 2 and the vehicle is flying in a mode that uses forward throttle instead of forward tilt to generate forward speed. Set to a non positive value 0 to deactivate this limit.

Q_ENABLE.Description: This enables QuadPlane functionality, assuming multicopter motors start on output 5. If this is set to 2 then when starting AUTO mode it will initially be in VTOL AUTO mode.

Q_ESC_CAL.Description: This is used to calibrate the throttle range of the VTOL motors. Please read https://ardupilot.org/plane/docs/quadplane-esc-calibration.html before using. This parameter is automatically set back to 0 on every boot. This parameter only takes effect in QSTABILIZE mode. When set to 1 the output of all motors will come directly from the throttle stick when armed, and will be zero when disarmed. When set to 2 the output of all motors will be maximum when armed and zero when disarmed. Make sure you remove all properllers before using.

Q_FRAME_CLASS.Description: Controls major frame class for multicopter component

Q_FRAME_TYPE.Description: Controls motor mixing for multicopter component

Q_FWD_MANTHR_MAX.Description: Maximum value for manual forward throttle; used with RC option FWD_THR (209)
Q_FWD_MANTHR_MAX.DisplayName: VTOL manual forward throttle max percent

Q_FWD_PIT_LIM.Description: When forward throttle is being controlled by the Q_FWD_THR_GAIN parameter in Q modes, the vehicle forward (nose down) pitch rotation will be limited to the value specified by this parameter and the any additional forward acceleration required will be produced by use of the forward thrust motor(s) or tilting of moveable rotors. Larger values allow the vehicle to pitch more nose down. Set initially to the amount of nose down pitch required to remove wing lift.

Q_FWD_THR_GAIN.Description: This parameter sets the gain from forward accel/tilt to forward throttle in certain Q modes. The Q modes this feature operates in is controlled by the Q_FWD_THR_USE parameter. Vehicles using separate forward thrust motors, eg quadplanes, should set this parameter to (all up weight) / (maximum combined thrust of forward motors) with a value of 2 being typical. Vehicles that tilt lifting rotors to provide forward thrust should set this parameter to (all up weight) / (weight lifted by tilting rotors) which for most aircraft can be approximated as (total number of lifting rotors) / (number of lifting rotors that tilt). When using this method of forward throttle control, the forward tilt angle limit is controlled by the Q_FWD_PIT_LIM parameter.

Q_FWD_THR_USE.Description: This parameter determines when the feature that uses forward throttle instead of forward tilt is used. The amount of forward throttle is controlled by the Q_FWD_THR_GAIN parameter. The maximum amount of forward pitch allowed is controlled by the Q_FWD_PIT_LIM parameter. Q_FWD_THR_USE = 0 disables the feature. Q_FWD_THR_USE = 1 enables the feature in all position controlled modes such as QLOITER, QLAND, QRTL and VTOL TAKEOFF. Q_FWD_THR_USE = 2 enables the feature in all Q modes except QAUTOTUNE and QACRO. When enabling the feature, the legacy method of controlling forward throttle use via velocity controller error should be disabled by setting Q_VFWD_GAIN to 0. Do not use this feature with tailsitters.

Values.1: On in all position controlled Q modes
Values.2: On in all Q modes except QAUTOTUNE and QACRO

Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD.Description: This provides the radius used, when using a fixed wing landing approach. If set to 0 then the WP_LOITER_RAD will be selected.
Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD.DisplayName: Quadplane fixed wing landing approach radius

Q_GUIDED_MODE.Description: This enables use of VTOL in guided mode. When enabled the aircraft will switch to VTOL flight when the guided destination is reached and hover at the destination.

Q_LAND_ALTCHG.Description: The maximum altitude change allowed during land detection. You can raise this value if you find that landing detection takes a long time to complete. It is the maximum change in altitude over a period of 4 seconds for landing to be detected

Q_LAND_FINAL_ALT.Description: The altitude at which we should switch to Q_LAND_SPEED descent rate

Q_LAND_FINAL_SPD.Description: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in m/s

Q_LAND_ICE_CUT.Description: This controls stopping an internal combustion engine in the final landing stage of a VTOL. This is important for aircraft where the forward thrust engine may experience prop-strike if left running during landing. This requires the engine controls are enabled using the ICE_* parameters.

Q_LOIT_ACC_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum correction acceleration in cm/s/s.  Higher values cause the copter to correct position errors more aggressively.

Q_LOIT_ANG_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum pilot requested lean angle. Set to zero for 2/3 of Q_P_ANGLE_MAX/Q_ANGLE_MAX. The maximum vehicle lean angle is still limited by Q_P_ANGLE_MAX/Q_ANGLE_MAX

Q_LOIT_BRK_ACCEL.Description: Loiter braking acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered.

Q_LOIT_BRK_JERK.Description: Loiter braking jerk in cm/s/s/s. Higher values will remove braking faster if the pilot moves the sticks during a braking maneuver.

Q_LOIT_SPEED.Description: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

Q_MAV_TYPE.Description: This controls the mavlink type given in HEARTBEAT messages. For some GCS types a particular setting will be needed for correct operation.

Q_M_BAT_CURR_MAX.Description: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

Q_M_BAT_CURR_TC.Description: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

Q_M_BAT_IDX.Description: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MAX.Description: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust).  Recommend 4.2 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MIN.Description: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust).  Recommend 3.3 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

Q_M_BOOST_SCALE.Description: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle.  The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

Q_M_HOVER_LEARN.Description: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

Q_M_PWM_MAX.Description: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

Q_M_PWM_MIN.Description: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

Q_M_PWM_TYPE.Description: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output.PWMRange and PWMAngle are PWM special/rare cases for ESCs that dont calibrate normally (some Sub motors) or where each ESC must have its PWM range set individually using the Servo params instead of PWM_MIN/MAX parameters.

Q_M_SAFE_DISARM.Description: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed
Q_M_SAFE_DISARM.DisplayName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed

Q_M_SAFE_TIME.Description: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.
Q_M_SAFE_TIME.DisplayName: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.

Q_M_SLEW_DN_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change.  Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.
Q_M_SLEW_DN_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for decreasing throttle

Q_M_SLEW_UP_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.
Q_M_SLEW_UP_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for increasing throttle

Q_M_SPIN_ARM.Description: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range.  Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

Q_M_SPIN_MAX.Description: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

Q_M_SPIN_MIN.Description: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range.  Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

Q_M_SPOOL_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

Q_M_SPOOL_TIM_DN.Description: Time taken to spool down the motors from min to zero throttle. If set to 0 then SPOOL_TIME is used instead.

Q_M_THST_EXPO.Description: Motor thrust curve exponent (0.0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

Q_M_THST_HOVER.Description: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

Q_M_YAW_HEADROOM.Description: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

Q_M_YAW_SV_ANGLE.Description: Yaw servo's maximum lean angle (Tricopter only)

Q_NAVALT_MIN.Description: This is the altitude in meters above which navigation begins in auto takeoff. Below this altitude the target roll and pitch will be zero. A value of zero disables the feature

Bitmask.0: Level Transition-keep wings within LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT and only use forward motor(s) for climb during transition
Bitmask.1: Allow FW Takeoff-if bit is not set then NAV_TAKEOFF command on quadplanes will instead perform a NAV_VTOL takeoff
Bitmask.10: Disarmed Yaw Tilt-enable motor tilt for yaw when disarmed
Bitmask.11: Delay Spoolup-delay VTOL spoolup for 2 seconds after arming
Bitmask.12: Disable speed based Qassist when using synthethic airspeed estimates
Bitmask.13: Disable Ground Effect Compensation-on baro altitude reports
Bitmask.14: Ignore forward flight angle limits-in Qmodes and use Q_ANGLE_MAX exclusively
Bitmask.15: ThrLandControl-enable throttle stick control of landing rate
Bitmask.16: DisableApproach-disable use of approach and airbrake stages in VTOL landing
Bitmask.17: EnableLandResposition-enable pilot controlled repositioning in AUTO land.Descent will pause while repositioning
Bitmask.18: ARMVTOL-arm only in VTOL or AUTO modes
Bitmask.19: CompleteTransition-to fixed wing if Q_TRANS_FAIL timer times out instead of QLAND
Bitmask.2: Allow FW Land-if bit is not set then NAV_LAND command on quadplanes will instead perform a NAV_VTOL_LAND
Bitmask.20: Force RTL mode-forces RTL mode on rc failsafe in VTOL modes overriding bit 5(USE_QRTL)
Bitmask.21: Tilt rotor-tilt motors up when disarmed in FW modes (except manual) to prevent ground strikes.
Bitmask.22: Scale FF by the ratio of VTOL/plane angle P gains in VTOL modes rather than reducing VTOL angle P based on airspeed.
Bitmask.3: Vtol Takeoff Frame-command NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF alt set by the command's reference frame not above current location
Bitmask.4: Always use FW spiral approach-always use Use a fixed wing spiral approach for VTOL landings
Bitmask.5: USE QRTL-instead of QLAND for rc failsafe when in VTOL modes
Bitmask.6: Use Governor-use ICE Idle Governor in MANUAL for forward motor
Bitmask.8: Mtrs_Only_Qassist-in tailsitters only uses VTOL motors and not flying surfaces for QASSIST

Q_OPTIONS.Description: See description for each bitmask bit description

Q_PILOT_ACCEL_Z.Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

Q_PILOT_SPD_DN.Description: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in m/s going down. If 0, uses Q_PILOT_SPD_UP value.

Q_PILOT_SPD_UP.Description: The maximum ascending vertical velocity the pilot may request in m/s

Q_PLT_Y_EXPO.Description: Pilot controlled yaw expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

Q_PLT_Y_RATE.Description: Pilot controlled yaw rate max. Used in all pilot controlled modes except QAcro

Q_PLT_Y_RATE_TC.Description: Pilot yaw rate control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response.
Q_PLT_Y_RATE_TC.DisplayName: Pilot yaw rate control input time constant

Q_P_ACCZ_D.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

Q_P_ACCZ_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

Q_P_ACCZ_FLTD.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_P_ACCZ_FLTD.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_P_ACCZ_FLTE.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz
Q_P_ACCZ_FLTE.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz

Q_P_ACCZ_FLTT.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz
Q_P_ACCZ_FLTT.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz

Q_P_ACCZ_I.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

Q_P_ACCZ_IMAX.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

Q_P_ACCZ_P.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

Q_P_ACCZ_PDMX.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

Q_P_ACCZ_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Q_P_ACC_XY_FILT.Description: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

Q_P_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle autopilot can request.  Set to zero to use ANGLE_MAX parameter value

Q_P_JERK_XY.Description: Jerk limit of the horizontal kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target
Q_P_JERK_XY.DisplayName: Jerk limit for the horizontal kinematic input shaping

Q_P_JERK_Z.Description: Jerk limit of the vertical kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target
Q_P_JERK_Z.DisplayName: Jerk limit for the vertical kinematic input shaping

Q_P_POSXY_P.Description: Position controller P gain.  Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

Q_P_POSZ_P.Description: Position (vertical) controller P gain.  Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

Q_P_VELXY_D.Description: Velocity (horizontal) D gain.  Corrects short-term changes in velocity

Q_P_VELXY_FF.Description: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain.  Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

Q_P_VELXY_FLTD.Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

Q_P_VELXY_FLTE.Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

Q_P_VELXY_I.Description: Velocity (horizontal) I gain.  Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

Q_P_VELXY_IMAX.Description: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum.  Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

Q_P_VELXY_P.Description: Velocity (horizontal) P gain.  Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

Q_P_VELZ_D.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller D gain.  Corrects short-term changes in velocity

Q_P_VELZ_FF.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller Feed Forward gain.  Produces an output that is proportional to the magnitude of the target

Q_P_VELZ_FLTD.Description: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D terms
Q_P_VELZ_FLTD.DisplayName: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term

Q_P_VELZ_FLTE.Description: Velocity (vertical) error filter.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

Q_P_VELZ_I.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

Q_P_VELZ_IMAX.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

Q_P_VELZ_P.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

Q_RC_SPEED.Description: This is the PWM refresh rate in Hz for QuadPlane quad motors

Q_RTL_ALT.Description: The altitude which QRTL mode heads to initially

Q_RTL_ALT_MIN.Description: If VTOL motors are active QRTL mode will VTOL climb to at least this altitude before returning home. If outside 150% the larger of WP_LOITER_RAD and RTL_RADIUS the vehicle will VTOL climb to Q_RTL_ALT. This parameter has no effect if the vehicle is in forward flight. Should be between Q_LAND_FINAL_ALT and Q_RTL_ALT

Q_RTL_MODE.Description: If this is set to 1 then an RTL will change to QRTL when within RTL_RADIUS meters of the RTL destination, VTOL approach: vehicle will RTL at RTL alt and circle with a radius of Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD down to Q_RTL_ALT and then transition into the wind and QRTL, see 'AUTO VTOL Landing', QRTL Always: do a QRTL instead of RTL

Q_TAILSIT_ANGLE.Description: This is the pitch angle at which tailsitter aircraft will change from VTOL control to fixed wing control.

Q_TAILSIT_ANG_VT.Description: This is the pitch angle at which tailsitter aircraft will change from fixed wing control to VTOL control, if zero Q_TAILSIT_ANGLE will be used

Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD.Description: This is the vehicle weight in kg divided by the total disk area of all propellers in m^2. Only used with Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK = 4

Q_TAILSIT_ENABLE.Description: This enables Tailsitter functionality. A value of 2 forces Qassist active and always stabilize in forward flight with airmode for stabilisation at 0 throttle, for use on vehicles with no control surfaces, vehicle will not arm in forward flight modes, see also Q_OPTIONS "Mtrs_Only_Qassist"

Q_TAILSIT_GSCMAX.Description: Maximum gain scaling for tailsitter Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK options

Q_TAILSIT_GSCMIN.Description: Minimum gain scaling for tailsitter Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK options

Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK.Description: Bitmask of gain scaling methods to be applied: Throttle: scale gains with throttle, ATT_THR: reduce gain at high throttle/tilt, 2:Disk theory velocity calculation, requires Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD to be set, ATT_THR must not be set, 3:Altitude correction, scale with air density

Q_TAILSIT_INPUT.Description: This controls whether stick input when hovering as a tailsitter follows the conventions for fixed wing hovering or multicopter hovering. When PlaneMode is not enabled (bit0 = 0) the roll stick will roll the aircraft in earth frame and yaw stick will yaw in earth frame. When PlaneMode input is enabled, the roll and yaw sticks are swapped so that the roll stick controls earth-frame yaw and rudder controls earth-frame roll. When body-frame roll is enabled (bit1 = 1), the yaw stick controls earth-frame yaw rate and the roll stick controls roll in the tailsitter's body frame when flying level.

Q_TAILSIT_MIN_VO.Description: Use in conjunction with disk theory gain scaling and Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD to specify minumum airspeed over control surfaces, this will be used to boost throttle, when descending for example, 0 disables
Q_TAILSIT_MIN_VO.DisplayName: Tailsitter Disk loading minimum outflow speed

Q_TAILSIT_MOTMX.Description: Bitmask of motors to remain active in forward flight for a 'Copter' tailsitter. Non-zero indicates airframe is a Copter tailsitter and uses copter style motor layouts determined by Q_FRAME_CLASS and Q_FRAME_TYPE. This should be zero for non-Copter tailsitters.

Q_TAILSIT_RAT_FW.Description: The pitch rate at which tailsitter aircraft will pitch down in the transition from VTOL to forward flight
Q_TAILSIT_RAT_FW.DisplayName: Tailsitter VTOL to forward flight transition rate

Q_TAILSIT_RAT_VT.Description: The pitch rate at which tailsitter aircraft will pitch up in the transition from forward flight to VTOL
Q_TAILSIT_RAT_VT.DisplayName: Tailsitter forward flight to VTOL transition rate

Q_TAILSIT_RLL_MX.Description: Maximum Allowed roll angle for tailsitters. If this is zero then Q_ANGLE_MAX is used.

Q_TAILSIT_THR_VT.Description: Throttle used during FW->VTOL transition, -1 uses hover throttle
Q_TAILSIT_THR_VT.DisplayName: Tailsitter forward flight to VTOL transition throttle

Q_TAILSIT_VFGAIN.Description: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in forward flight for a vectored tailsitter
Q_TAILSIT_VFGAIN.DisplayName: Tailsitter vector thrust gain in forward flight

Q_TAILSIT_VHGAIN.Description: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in hover for a vectored tailsitter
Q_TAILSIT_VHGAIN.DisplayName: Tailsitter vector thrust gain in hover

Q_TAILSIT_VHPOW.Description: This controls the amount of extra pitch given to the vectored control when at high pitch errors

Q_TAILSIT_VT_P_P.Description: Scale from PID output to control surface, for use where a single axis is actuated by both motors and Tilt/control surface on a copter style tailsitter, increase to favor control surfaces and reduce motor output by reducing gains
Q_TAILSIT_VT_P_P.DisplayName: Tailsitter VTOL control surface pitch gain

Q_TAILSIT_VT_R_P.Description: Scale from PID output to control surface, for use where a single axis is actuated by both motors and Tilt/control surface on a copter style tailsitter, increase to favor control surfaces and reduce motor output by reducing gains
Q_TAILSIT_VT_R_P.DisplayName: Tailsitter VTOL control surface roll gain

Q_TAILSIT_VT_Y_P.Description: Scale from PID output to control surface, for use where a single axis is actuated by both motors and Tilt/control surface on a copter style tailsitter, increase to favor control surfaces and reduce motor output by reducing gains
Q_TAILSIT_VT_Y_P.DisplayName: Tailsitter VTOL control surface yaw gain

Q_THROTTLE_EXPO.Description: Amount of curvature in throttle curve: 0 is linear, 1 is cubic

Q_TILT_FIX_ANGLE.Description: This is the angle the motors tilt down when at maximum output for forward flight. Set this to a non-zero value to enable vectoring for roll/pitch in forward flight on tilt-vectored aircraft

Q_TILT_FIX_GAIN.Description: This is the gain for use of tilting motors in fixed wing flight for tilt vectored quadplanes

Q_TILT_MASK.Description: This is a bitmask of motors that are tiltable in a tiltrotor (or tiltwing). The mask is in terms of the standard motor order for the frame type.

Q_TILT_MAX.Description: This is the maximum angle of the tiltable motors at which multicopter control will be enabled. Beyond this angle the plane will fly solely as a fixed wing aircraft and the motors will tilt to their maximum angle at the TILT_RATE

Q_TILT_RATE_DN.Description: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from hover to forward flight. When this is zero the Q_TILT_RATE_UP value is used.

Q_TILT_RATE_UP.Description: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from forward flight to hover

Q_TILT_TYPE.Description: This is the type of tiltrotor when TILT_MASK is non-zero. A continuous tiltrotor can tilt the rotors to any angle on demand. A binary tiltrotor assumes a retract style servo where the servo is either fully forward or fully up. In both cases the servo can't move faster than Q_TILT_RATE. A vectored yaw tiltrotor will use the tilt of the motors to control yaw in hover, Bicopter tiltrotor must use the tailsitter frame class (10)

Q_TILT_WING_FLAP.Description: For use on tilt wings, the wing will tilt up to this angle for flap, transition will be complete when the wing reaches this angle from the forward fight position, 0 disables
Q_TILT_WING_FLAP.DisplayName: Tiltrotor tilt angle that will be used as flap

Q_TILT_YAW_ANGLE.Description: This is the angle of the tilt servos when in VTOL mode and at minimum output (fully back). This needs to be set in addition to Q_TILT_TYPE=2, to enable vectored control for yaw in tilt quadplanes. This is also used to limit the forward travel of bicopter tilts(Q_TILT_TYPE=3) when in VTOL modes.
Q_TILT_YAW_ANGLE.DisplayName: Tilt minimum angle for vectored yaw

Q_TKOFF_ARSP_LIM.Description: Airspeed limit during takeoff. If the airspeed exceeds this level the vehicle will switch to QLAND. This is useful for ensuring that you don't takeoff into excessively strong wind. If set to 0 there is no limit on airspeed during takeoff.

Q_TKOFF_FAIL_SCL.Description: Scalar for how long past the expected takeoff time a takeoff should be considered as failed and the vehicle will switch to QLAND. If set to 0 there is no limit on takeoff time.

Q_TRANSITION_MS.Description: Transition time in milliseconds after minimum airspeed is reached

Q_TRANS_DECEL.Description: This is deceleration rate that will be used in calculating the stopping distance when transitioning from fixed wing flight to multicopter flight.

Q_TRANS_FAIL.Description: Maximum time allowed for forward transitions, exceeding this time will cancel the transition and the aircraft will immediately change to the mode set by Q_TRANS_FAIL_ACT or finish the transition depending on Q_OPTIONS bit 19. 0 for no limit.

Q_TRANS_FAIL_ACT.Description: This sets the mode that is changed to when Q_TRANS_FAIL time elapses, if set. See also Q_OPTIONS bit 19: CompleteTransition if Q_TRANS_FAIL

Q_TRAN_PIT_MAX.Description: Maximum pitch during transition to auto fixed wing flight

Q_TRIM_PITCH.Description: This sets the compensation for the pitch angle trim difference between calibrated AHRS level and vertical flight pitch. NOTE! this is relative to calibrated AHRS trim, not forward flight trim which includes PTCH_TRIM_DEG. For tailsitters, this is relative to a baseline of 90 degrees in AHRS.

Q_VFWD_ALT.Description: Controls altitude to disable forward velocity assist when below this relative altitude. This is useful to keep the forward velocity propeller from hitting the ground. Rangefinder height data is incorporated when available.

Q_VFWD_GAIN.Description: The use of this parameter is no longer recommended and has been superseded by a method that works in all VTOL modes with the exception of QAUTOTUNE which is controlled by the Q_FWD_THR_USE parameter. This Q_VFD_GAIN parameter controls use of the forward motor in VTOL modes that use the velocity controller. Set to 0 to disable this function. A value of 0.05 is a good place to start if you want to use the forward motor for position control. No forward motor will be used in QSTABILIZE or QHOVER modes. Use with QLOITER for position hold with the forward motor.

Q_WP_ACCEL.Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Q_WP_ACCEL_C.Description: Defines the maximum cornering acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions.  If zero uses 2x accel value.

Q_WP_ACCEL_Z.Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Q_WP_JERK.Description: Defines the horizontal jerk in m/s/s used during missions

Q_WP_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

Q_WP_RFND_USE.Description: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following
Q_WP_RFND_USE.DisplayName: Waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

Q_WP_SPEED.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

Q_WP_SPEED_DN.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

Q_WP_SPEED_UP.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

Q_WP_TER_MARGIN.Description: Waypoint Terrain following altitude margin.  Vehicle will stop if distance from target altitude is larger than this margin (in meters)

Q_WVANE_ANG_MIN.Description: The minimum target roll/pitch angle before active weathervaning will start.  This provides a dead zone that is particularly useful for poorly trimmed quadplanes.

Q_WVANE_ENABLE.Description: Enable weather vaning.  When active, the aircraft will automatically yaw into wind when in a VTOL position controlled mode. Pilot yaw commands override the weathervaning action.

Values.-1: Only use during takeoffs or landing see weathervane takeoff and land override parameters

Q_WVANE_GAIN.Description: This converts the target roll/pitch angle of the aircraft into the correcting (into wind) yaw rate. e.g. Gain = 2, roll = 30 deg, pitch = 0 deg, yaw rate = 60 deg/s.

Q_WVANE_HGT_MIN.Description: Above this height weathervaning is permitted.  If RNGFND_LANDING is enabled or terrain is enabled then this parameter sets height AGL. Otherwise this parameter sets height above home.  Set zero to ignore minimum height requirement to activate weathervaning

Q_WVANE_LAND.Description: Override the weather vaning behaviour when in landing

Bitmask.0: Use pitch when nose or tail-in for faster weathervaning

Q_WVANE_SPD_MAX.Description: Below this ground speed weathervaning is permitted. Set to 0 to ignore this condition when checking if vehicle should weathervane.

Q_WVANE_TAKEOFF.Description: Override the weather vaning behaviour when in takeoffs

Q_WVANE_VELZ_MAX.Description: The maximum climb or descent speed that the vehicle will still attempt to weathervane. Set to 0 to ignore this condition to get the aircraft to weathervane at any climb/descent rate.  This is particularly useful for aircraft with low disc loading that struggle with yaw control in decent.

Q_YAW_RATE_MAX.Description: This is the maximum yaw rate for pilot input on rudder stick in degrees/second

RALLY_INCL_HOME.Description: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

RALLY_LIMIT_KM.Description: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

RALLY_TOTAL.Description: Number of rally points currently loaded

RC10_DZ.Description: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

RC10_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC10_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC10_OPTION.Description: Function assigned to this RC channel

Values.154: ArmDisarm with Quadplane AirMode (4.2 and higher)
Values.155: Set roll pitch and yaw trim to current servo and RC

RC10_REVERSED.Description: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

RC10_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RCK_DEBUG.Description: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

RCK_ENABLE.Description: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

RCK_FORCEHL.Description: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

RCK_PERIOD.Description: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

RCMAP_PITCH.Description: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.  Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_ROLL.Description: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.  Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_THROTTLE.Description: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_YAW.Description: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.  Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RC_FS_TIMEOUT.Description: RC failsafe will trigger this many seconds after loss of RC

Bitmask.11: Use Link Quality for RSSI with CRSF
Bitmask.12: Annotate CRSF flight mode with * on disarm
Bitmask.2: Ignore Receiver Failsafe bit but allow other RC failsafes if setup
Bitmask.6: Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yaw sticks
Bitmask.9: Suppress CRSF mode/rate message for ELRS systems

RC_OVERRIDE_TIME.Description: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

RC_PROTOCOLS.Description: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

RELAY10_DEFAULT.Description: Should the relay default to on or off, this only applies to RELAYx_FUNC "Relay" (1). All other uses will pick the appropriate default output state from within the controlling function's parameters. Note that if INVERTED is set then the default is inverted.

RELAY10_FUNCTION.Description: The function the relay channel is mapped to.

RELAY10_INVERTED.Description: Should the relay output signal be inverted. If enabled, relay on would be pin low and relay off would be pin high. NOTE: this impact's DEFAULT.

RELAY10_PIN.Description: Digital pin number for relay control. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RLL2SRV_RMAX.Description: This sets the maximum roll rate that the attitude controller will demand (degrees/sec) in angle stabilized modes. Setting it to zero disables this limit.

RLL2SRV_TCONST.Description: Time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved roll angle. Most models respond well to 0.5. May be reduced for faster responses, but setting lower than a model can achieve will not help.

RLL_RATE_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
RLL_RATE_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain

RLL_RATE_D_FF.Description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

RLL_RATE_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
RLL_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

RLL_RATE_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
RLL_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

RLL_RATE_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
RLL_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

RLL_RATE_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
RLL_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

RLL_RATE_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
RLL_RATE_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain

RLL_RATE_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum that the I term will output
RLL_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum

RLL_RATE_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Corrects in proportion to the difference between the desired roll rate vs actual roll rate
RLL_RATE_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain

RLL_RATE_PDMX.Description: Roll axis rate controller PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output
RLL_RATE_PDMX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller PD sum maximum

RLL_RATE_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

RNGFND1_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND1_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND1_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND1_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V. For PWM input, the pin must be configured as a digital GPIO, see the Wiki's "GPIOs" section for details.

RNGFND1_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND1_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND1_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND1_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

RNGFND1_SNR_MIN.Description: RangeFinder Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND1_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RNGFND1_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND1_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND8_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND8_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND8_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

RNGFND8_SNR_MIN.Description: RangeFinder Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND8_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RNGFND8_WSP_AVG.Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

RNGFND8_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND8_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND8_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND8_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND9_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND9_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND9_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND9_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND9_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND9_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND9_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND9_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V. For PWM input, the pin must be configured as a digital GPIO, see the Wiki's "GPIOs" section for details.

RNGFND9_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND9_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND9_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND9_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND9_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND9_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND9_SNR_MIN.Description: RangeFinder Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RNGFND9_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFNDA_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFNDA_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFNDA_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFNDA_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFNDA_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFNDA_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFNDA_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFNDA_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V. For PWM input, the pin must be configured as a digital GPIO, see the Wiki's "GPIOs" section for details.

RNGFNDA_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFNDA_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.
